channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: MOKB Premiere : Ash Reiter : “Night Moves” (Bob Seger Cover)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: San Francisco’s rocker Ash Reiter has been touring all over the several months with her band in support of their latest effort, HOLA. The underrated album, drenched in heavy California sunshine, was released last fall and can be purchased here. During the touring, Reiter found time to record a cover of Bob Seger’s coming-of-age [...]
item.content:encoded:
San Francisco’s rocker Ash Reiter has been touring all over the several months with her band in support of their latest effort, HOLA. The underrated album, drenched in heavy California sunshine, was released last fall and can be purchased here. During the touring, Reiter found time to record a cover of Bob Seger’s coming-of-age song “Night Moves” with the help of her friends The Blank Tapes’ Matt Adams & DA Humphrey and Amber Gougis.

“Night Moves” is one of three covers the band is will be releasing with custom artwork chosen by kickstarter supporters that backed their most recent full-length. While the cover is pretty true to the original, it always nice to have a contemporary artist bring attention to new listeners a classic tune. Stream and download it below.

item.title: Song : Houndmouth : “On The Road”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.category: From the Hills Below the City
item.description: After what has been too long of a wait, our Indiana brethren and recession rockers (thanks to Zach from WLFY for that description) Houndmouth have announced the release of their proper full-length debut, From the Hills Below the City, on June 4th via Rough Trade. The first single from the LP is the shining, [...]
item.content:encoded: After what has been too long of a wait, our Indiana brethren and recession rockers (thanks to Zach from WLFY for that description) Houndmouth have announced the release of their proper full-length debut, From the Hills Below the City, on June 4th via Rough Trade. The first single from the LP is the shining, Kerouacian cut “On The Road”. This is a track you may have heard the band playing live over the past few months if you have been able to catch them in concert. Listen below.

item.title: Song : M83 : “Oblivion” (Feat. Susanne Sundfør)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Anthony Gonzalez, better known as M83, will be scoring the new Tom Cruise epic Oblivion. We heard previously “Starwaves”, now we get the epic new title track to the score. The song appears in the movie at the end credits. It is quintessential Gonzalez and sounds as if it could have [...]
item.content:encoded:
Anthony Gonzalez, better known as M83, will be scoring the new Tom Cruise epic Oblivion. We heard previously “Starwaves”, now we get the epic new title track to the score. The song appears in the movie at the end credits. It is quintessential Gonzalez and sounds as if it could have been on his most recent LP, Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming. The Oblivion soundtrack is out April 9th via Back Lot. Listen below.

Previous:

item.title: Video : Phosphorescent : “Song for Zula”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Matthew Houck, the man behind Phosphorescent, and Djuna Wahlrab directed a video for the beautiful first single from the album Muchacho (out now via Dead Oceans). The clip is a simple one showing a woman trying to break free from the chains that bind her, literally. Watch below.
item.content:encoded: Matthew Houck, the man behind Phosphorescent, and Djuna Wahlrab directed a video for the beautiful first single from the album Muchacho (out now via Dead Oceans). The clip is a simple one showing a woman trying to break free from the chains that bind her, literally. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Fyfe : “Lies”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: London’s Paul Dixon, aka Fyfe, revealed another track from his upcoming Solace EP due out next month. “Lies” is not as immediate as the prevously released “St. Tropez”, but definitely shows he will not be a one trick pony. Grab a listen and download the song below.
item.content:encoded: London’s Paul Dixon, aka Fyfe, revealed another track from his upcoming Solace EP due out next month. “Lies” is not as immediate as the prevously released “St. Tropez”, but definitely shows he will not be a one trick pony. Grab a listen and download the song below.

item.title: Song : Active Child : “Evening Ceremony”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Active Child unleashed an absolutely stunning, emotionally charged new song. “Evening Ceremony” will appear on the soundtrack for The Host, a new movie directed by Andrew Niccol. Pat Grossi’s vocals and production are just as compelling as ever. It is everything you would want out of a Grossi tune. Curl up [...]
item.content:encoded: Active Child unleashed an absolutely stunning, emotionally charged new song. “Evening Ceremony” will appear on the soundtrack for The Host, a new movie directed by Andrew Niccol. Pat Grossi’s vocals and production are just as compelling as ever. It is everything you would want out of a Grossi tune. Curl up on your bed, put on your headphones and be prepared to listen over and over again.

item.title: Kickstarter Spotlight : Good Graeff : Better Half EP
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Good Graeff acoustic folk pop duo of twins Brooke and Brittany Graeff. The two formed the project when they were just 16 years old in Florida. Bucking the trends of most twins, they both went their separate way with Brooke heading off to Canada and Brittany to Europe. MP3: Good Graeff – [...]
item.content:encoded:
Good Graeff acoustic folk pop duo of twins Brooke and Brittany Graeff. The two formed the project when they were just 16 years old in Florida. Bucking the trends of most twins, they both went their separate way with Brooke heading off to Canada and Brittany to Europe.

MP3: Good Graeff – Hold Me Fast

Last year, the two reunited in Vietnam and immediately started playing music together again for an outlet with no intentions of it turning into anything serious. However, after their neighbors heard the duo, they were asked to play a party and received positive praise.

The girls now are heavy into a Kickstarter campaign to help fund their EP and upcoming tour. Right now, they are approximately $1400 away from their $10000 goal with just a little under three day remaining. Head over to their Kickstarter page and support this promising project with any amount you can scrounge together big or small. As they say, every little bit counts.

item.title: Song : Dark Dark Dark : “What I Needed”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Coming on the heels of their much lauded album, Who Needs Who, Minneapolis’ Dark Dark Dark will be getting involved in the Record Store Day festivities with the release of a new EP, What I Needed, featuring three new songs. Recorded during the sessions of their latest album and in the aftermath of a [...]
item.content:encoded:
Coming on the heels of their much lauded album, Who Needs Who, Minneapolis’ Dark Dark Dark will be getting involved in the Record Store Day festivities with the release of a new EP, What I Needed, featuring three new songs. Recorded during the sessions of their latest album and in the aftermath of a relationship breakdown between band co-founders Marshall LaCount and Nona Marie Invie, the band felt these songs deserved their own place seperate of the full-length. Listen to the title track of the EP below. The song has a very 60s, girl group quality about it.

Tour Dates:
May 8 – Brugge, BE @ Cactus Club
May 9 – Rotterdam, NL @ Rotown
May 10-Sun.-May 12 – Camber Sands, UK @ All Tomorrow’s Parties (curated by TV on the Radio)
May 13 – Antwerp, BE @ Trix

item.title: Video : Wavves : “Demon To Lean On”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Wavves released their new album, Afraid of Heights, today via Mom + Pop/Warner Bros. To celebrate the occassion, the band released a new video for “Demon To Lean On”, directed by BLACK // DOCTOR (Chris Black and MISTERDOCTOR). The video sees a car getting towed to a junkyard with a boy sleeping inside [...]
item.content:encoded:
Wavves released their new album, Afraid of Heights, today via Mom + Pop/Warner Bros. To celebrate the occassion, the band released a new video for “Demon To Lean On”, directed by BLACK // DOCTOR (Chris Black and MISTERDOCTOR). The video sees a car getting towed to a junkyard with a boy sleeping inside it. The boy ends up getting pulled into a whole society of people who are making the junkyard their home. Check it out below.

Tour Dates:
03-27 Denver, CO – Larimer Lounge *
03-28 Omaha, NE – Waiting Room *

item.title: Song : Pure X : “Someone Else”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Cinematic, gloomy, emotional could all be appropriate in describing the latest song, “Someone Else”, from Austin, TX trio Pure X. The song will appear on their forthcoming album, Crawling Up The Stairs, slated for release on May 14th via Acéphale. The rawness of this track cuts to the bone with every screech and [...]
item.content:encoded:
Cinematic, gloomy, emotional could all be appropriate in describing the latest song, “Someone Else”, from Austin, TX trio Pure X. The song will appear on their forthcoming album, Crawling Up The Stairs, slated for release on May 14th via Acéphale. The rawness of this track cuts to the bone with every screech and crack of the voice. Listen below.

MP3: Pure X – Someone Else
